ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Geotail Regime Identification and Distant Tail Variability
ResourceHeader.Description: Geotail Regime Identification for the Deep Tail Phase of the Mission. The Time Resolution of the Data Set is Variable since the Regime ID is only listed when Geotail passes from one Regime to Another with Times listed to the Nearest Minute.

InformationURL.Name: Magnetospheric Plasma Regimes identified using Geotail Measurements 1. Regime Identification and Distant Tail Variability
InformationURL.Description: Journal of Geophysical Research, Volume 103, Issue A10, Pages 23503-23520, October 1, 1998

InformationURL.Name: Magnetospheric Plasma Regimes using Geotail Measurements 2: Statistics, Spatial Distribution, and Geomagnetic Dependence
InformationURL.Description: Journal of Geophysical Research, Volume 103, Issue A10, Pages 23521-23542, October 1, 1998

InformationURL.Name: Description of Regime ID data product
InformationURL.Description: A Description of the GEOTAIL Magnetospheric Regime Identification Data Product

InformationURL.Name: JHU/APL GEOTAIL/EPIC Science Data Center (SDC)
InformationURL.Description: The SDC is the central processing and analysis facility for the EPIC particle instrument, one of seven instruments in the GEOTAIL mission

AccessURL.Description: Geotail Regime ID file in ASCII at EPIC

Parameter.Name: Time
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter exhibits an increasing monotonic progression.

Parameter.Name: Interval
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Time Interval spanned when Geotail remained within a Single Plasma Regime

Parameter.Name: Kp Minimum
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Kp Minimum during the Regime Time Interval

Parameter.Name: Kp Average
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Kp Average during the Regime Time Interval

Parameter.Name: Kp Maximum
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Kp Maximum during the Regime Time Interval

Parameter.Name: Start Position (GSE)
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Position of Geotail at the Start of the Time Interval for the given Regime, Cartesian GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Stop Position (GSE)
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Position of Geotail at the End of the Time Interval for the given Regime, Cartesian GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Region
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Caveats:
BL    - Boundary Layer: Mantle here; High B (>5 Gauss), +Bx (>4 Gauss), Low dB, no EM Waves
                  BS    - Bow Shock (similar to SW)
                  Cal   - Calibration Period
                  d(cs) - Distance to Current Sheet
                  FF    - Fast Flow Event (similar to PS)
                  FL    - Flare, used when there is some Flare Background
                  FR    - Flow Reversal
                  LB    - Lobe: Mostly <1 keV Ions
                  MG    - Magnetosphere: Ions >1-5 keV, 1-10 keV Electrons (e-) (similar to PS)
                  MS    - Magnetosheath: Low B (<5 Gauss), -Bx, High dB, EM Waves, >1 keV Ions
                  PS    - Plasma Sheet: 100 eV+ Ions, < ~1 keV Electrons (e-)
                  RF    - Reduced Flow (See p. 3 of the Publication identified in Information URL)
                  Rot   - B Rotation without Boundary in Plasma
                  RTO   - Repeated Transient Observations
                  Sat   - 'Saturated' Plasma Instrument Readout(s) or Data was Difficult to Interpret
                  SW    - Solar Wind
                  Gap   - No ID Available due to a Gap in the Data Record
                  ?     - Unknown
                  No_ID - No ID characterizes the Period

Parameter.Name: RegionID
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH

Parameter.Name: Region Notes
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
